Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cjl80
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly! Room was nice & clean! We stayed there 2 nights after the Supercross race at the Lucas Oil Stadium. We were with our kids, ages 17 & 12 along with our daughters friend and my 8 year old nephew. They had a blast. There were tons kids at the hotel. They all had a blast. They played tag, hung out in the lobby, explored the whole hotel,met new friends from all over! You couldn't hear any of the kids from our room out in the hallway having a good time! I would recommend this hotel to any!

Reviews.Title: “Crowne Missing Jewels”
Reviews.Author: seth v
Reviews.Content: Yes this hotel has all of the things that we business travelers want when we are choosing a hotel. However we need to look closer at some of the ratings that we give certain hotels. This hotel has some major issues. The biggest being that it is located 1 mile off of the runway of Indy's airport. No matter what else the hotel may offer it is overshadowed by that one simple fact. If you want rest or peace and quiet after a long day of work? Do Not stay at this hotel. If you are absolutely crazy about airplanes and the noise they create when flying over you will love it there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel has sloppy management.”
Reviews.Author: peetND
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the crowne plaza hotel for business this past week. The service overall was friendly and efficient. I liked the little welcome bag and overall checkin process. The hotel decor was interesting - from the fountain feature on the main floor plus victorian furniture on the 5th floor. I chose to upgrade to the executive club level. This turned out to be a mistake. Upon arriving in my room I was greeted with dishes at my front door. The wallpaper in my room was peeling. Also the club lounge was lacking in special features. Overall the hotel is okay but wasn't worth the extra money for the club level.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, great room but bring ear plugs.”
Reviews.Author: CandidOpinions
Reviews.Content: Check in was great. Hotel has cool architecture with numerous functional meeting and gathering spaces. Property is right next to the airport with shuttle service. The rooms were comfy, clean and modern. The landing path for the airport is RIGHT OVER the hotel. FedEx planes land every 3 minutes from 11pm until 1am. I am not a light sleeper, and did not find it to be a big issue, but if you don't sleep well with noise plan accordingly. The restaurant staff was 'blah' but the breakfast was yummy. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: trvlnman101
Reviews.Content: I stay here once a month for business. I always Hotwire it and love everything about it except one thing. I am treated as a second class citizen due to the Hotwire rate. Even though I am a Priority Club member, I'm not given a room on the forth floor which is reserved for PC members. I usually get stuck on a ground floor room facing the parking lot and have car lights shine in my window. I probably could insist on a better room. This is not the only CP that does this when I Hotwire. At some, there will be a USA Today outside every room but mine!!

Reviews.Title: “Guest Services didn't offer good service”
Reviews.Author: Staci R
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed to learn the room we had booked was essentially shifted over to another group the hotel wanted to keep together, so although we had three guests in the room, we had only a king bed available. When I had called the night prior to our check-in to confirm the reservation, was informed of the issue w/ our room and asked what could be done and was assured a rollaway would be provided at no extra charge. Of course, upon arrival, our room only had the king bed, and we were informed all the rollaways were already distributed. If you can't accommodate a full hotel, don't fill up your hotel, and if a "reservation" doesn't really mean anything, why even make one? We were offered no discount. Manager referred us to his supervisor who wasn't available all weekend, and hasn't returned any phone calls. Not good customer service!

Reviews.Title: “awesome stay and play package!”
Reviews.Author: tessie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our children and purchased the stay and play Indy package. This was an amazing deal! It included two adult passes and two children passes to the zoo and children's museum, and a one night stay at the hotel. The room was nice, clean, and quiet. We really enjoyed the indoor pool and hot tub in the atrium. Most indoor pools are in tiny rooms and you feel you are suffocating in chlorine fumes! Not so here. We did not eat at the hotel as it seemed pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you need by the Airport in Indi!”
Reviews.Author: pclonger
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few nights in Dec 2011 for a conference. It is nice place to stay if you need to be by the airport. Can get noisy at night since planes do fly right over. I am a light sleeper so just turned up the fan and slept okay. The staff were all great and hard to believe, the food was very good for a conference. A lot of good choices. Even the food buffet for lunch before we left was very good. Rooms were okay==clean. It is an interesting building with very nice small meeting rooms. Easy access to downtown on the express way that ends right in front of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mandy s
Reviews.Content: We got three rooms. The front desk staff ensured the rooms were close, 203, 205, 207. We ate in the restaurant, and everything was delicious. Mila made sure we had everything we needed, and we did not leave hungry or thirsty. Mila was not only nice, but charming and entertaining. Heather was very delightful in the morning for breakfast. I was disappointed with the breakfast as there was no gravy available, but Heather's customer service skills made up for it. The rooms were clean, but one of the rooms had an empty mouthwash bottle neatly placed where a full one should have been, and it was missing the lavender spray from the little amenity bag on the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Mea A
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a military retreat for married couples, it was all paid for so I can't really talk about the value for the price since we didn't pay... BUT I will say that the place is great, the room was a King, very spacious. Everything was clean and very well kept. It had a flat screen TV and very new-looking furniture. We were given breakfast buffet at their adjacent restaurant. It was pretty good, I mean...pretty average to what a breakfast buffet would be. We had a couple get-togethers with the rest of the couples, one in their very nice quaint little meeting room, and another in just a regular room in the downstairs area. This is a great place to have conferences and things of the like. The staff is very courteous and caring since they are always watching to see if you need water or coffee during a meeting. The only cons I have for this stay are: The pool is tiny and awkwardly placed in the middle of the hotel. Also, don't get fooled by it being in Indianapolis because it's really on the outskirts and there isn't anything around there, even to go to the nearest grocery store requires for you to get on the highway.

Reviews.Title: “very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrOutdoor42609
Reviews.Content: It was an excellent stay. we didn't have any troble getting to the hotel. also, it was a very clean room. but bathroom was very small.the tv was very big. luckily, for us we didn't hear the airplane noise during the night! (maybe the airplane could have landed on the other side.) the swimming pool and hot tub were both very clean. but restraut was very pricey.

Reviews.Title: “clean, friendly, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Krissymom
Reviews.Content: Traveled with a group of roughly 400 teens for a Youth Conference. The beds were comfortable, the rooms were clean, as well as the banquet and pool area. The public restroom by the restaurant was tidy as well. We had breakfast with Hotel catering and it was very good. (eggs, bacon, french toast or waffles) We did not have much time at the hotel other than sleeping and breakfast, but what I saw was very good over a period of 4 days. I did notice, however, the lack of REFRIGERATORs in the room. I guess I'm just used to staying places--even dumps--that have refrigerators. I assume if you really need one, you can get one? I dont know. There is coffee in the room, hairdryer, shampoo etc. and I appreciated the lighted, magnifying mirror. No lobby coffee. I dont know how much it cost, because someone else took care of all that.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE THIS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: ijustgottago
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and just like before enjoyed my stay. The construction is really bad in the area making it hard to get around the area. The front desk staff is great, The bar staff is great, The shuttle drivers were all very helpful. Look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: TravelWithPrJim
Reviews.Content: It's not often that I stay in a hotel that I am torn between rating as excellent or as terrible. The Crowne Plaza Indianapolis Airport is such a hotel. My stay got off to a very inauspicious start when I arrived on a Thursday night. I used the courtesy phone by the airport baggage carousels to let the hotel know I was ready and waiting. "We'll send somebody right over," said the gentlemen on the other end of the line. I waited on a brisk cold night as other hotel shuttle vans came and went like clockwork, until the van from the Crowne Plaza finally arrived an hour and four minutes later. The personable driver said he had never received a call about my being there waiting. Luckily, two other hotel guests had arrived and called for the shuttle. Otherwise, I might still be waiting. When I signed in, I told the desk clerk of my exceedingly long wait. He said he would look into it and find out why. The next morning I asked at the desk if they had figured out what happened. Nobody seemed to know a thing about it, but they did a call a manager to discuss the matter with me. That manager, whose name appears frequently with management responses on these pages, was quite apologetic, and offered me a complimentary breakfast (which would value my waiting time somewhere near minimum wage). She then offered a significant room rate reduction. My charitable guess is that whoever answered the phone got very busy right after hanging up and forgot to page the shuttle driver. The other notable problem at the Airport Crowne Plaza is that it is directly under the flight path to the airport, which is a major FedEx hub. FedEx still flies many Boeing 727 aircraft, one of the noisiest planes in the sky, even when equipped with a hush kit. From 11:30 p.m. to 2 or 3 a.m., planes come screaming in for a landing every minute or two, so close I felt as if I could touch them from my fifth floor room. Prevailing winds and the runway arrangement at Indianapolis airport dictate that most of the time, planes will be landing right over the hotel. The hotel thoughtfully provides earplugs, but they are they aren't very effective. Mercifully for me, FedEx all but shuts down on Friday and Saturday nights, so sleep was much less disturbed those nights. The hotel itself is a beautiful building, with interesting architecture. Staff throughout the hotel, including the servers in the hotel restaurant and bar, were friendly, good-humored, and courteous. My spacious room was immaculately clean, properly made up each day. Wired or wireless internet is complimentary. I was at the hotel for a service club training event. It included two breakfasts and a lunch served buffet-style, and dinner served banquet style. The staff assigned to our group were a delight, friendly and efficient. The buffet meals were delicious with a wide choice of foods. As a vegetarian, however, I was disappointed with my banquet plate: rice, broccoli and a broiled half tomato. Not much protein in that meal. Our whole large group was checking out just before noon on Sunday. We would have overwhelmed the shuttle van's capacity to get us to the airport in a timely fashion. The hotel very courteously and thoughtfully arranged for a shuttle bus from a neighbouring Holiday Inn to supplement their van. It's a nice hotel with a really good staff. It's a shame my visit got off to a bad start. I would certainly give them another chance the next time I visit Indianapolis.

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel, but right under flight path”
Reviews.Author: megria
Reviews.Content: This hotel is directly under the flight path of FedEx and maybe other planes. And they're flying low when they go by. So this place can get loud. The lobby was a sort of dramatic atrium, surprising for a hotel chain airport, at least to me. It's kind of plain, though. The room was pretty good with the usual amenities. The price was a little steep for what we got, but that may have been because of a big convention in town.

Reviews.Title: “Difficult to reach this overrated hotel”
Reviews.Author: bossfan59
Reviews.Content: Thankfully we only paid $60 for this place on Hotwire (which claimed it was 3-1/2 star property). While the rooms may have been renovated, the overall decor is stuck in the 70s. I swear the pool, in an open atrium, was in the movie Cedar Rapids! When kids were in the pool, you could hear their screaming even in a room on the third floor down a hallway. 465 is under construction at both exits near the hotel so it's a bit difficult to get there. bed was not too bad, despite being pretty firm. Good shower pressure but towels were pretty rough. Wouldn't pay full price for this property.

Reviews.Title: “Racist Bartender!!!”
Reviews.Author: MsTab
Reviews.Content: Before writing this review, I contacted the Crowne Plaza via the company's website (email) for a response. After 4 days I still haven't heard anything. I arrived at the Crowne Plaza on Thursday, September 15, 2011. Having already stayed in two hotels in one week, I was very exhausted. When Chris checked me in, I was informed that I was upgraded to floor 5. I was very appreciative for that!! Chris was very pleasant, professional and very nice. I was very pleased with my room and the entire decor. I relaxed about an hour or so before my coworkers called me down to meet them at the bar. By the time I arrived at the bar, all of my coworkers had alcoholic beverages. One of my coworker got up from the bar for me to sit there. I sit there for 10 minutes. And another 10 minutes. And another 10 minutes before Michelle opened her mouth to ask if I wanted anything. I was the only black in the bar and not once did she ask me what I would like to drink. I noticed that Michelle asked other patrons at the bar and in the lounge for drinks. She even waited on a patron sitting next to me! Finally when my coworker asked for their checks (30 minutes later), Michelle finally asked if I wanted anything. I replied, "Yes, 30 minutes ago." I refused to believe that Michelle did not see me sitting at the bar. Apparently the Crowne Plaza supports this behavior since I have not received a response from them. Unfortunately this experience warrants a bad review and overshadowed the great customer service I received from Chris.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: quikdog42389
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 1 night for a business meeting. Check in was very quick and professional. The room was nice, clean, not huge room but updated. Bed was very comfortable, with plenty of pillows, nice feather top. Room was quiet in spite of the jets going overhead. Had a number of meals catered by the hotel and all were good. Nothing over the top but it’s a hotel buffet. Internet was free both wired in the room and wireless available everywhere. Had breakfast at the restaurant (The Landing), nice buffet, prices were reasonable. Nice place for business meeting or an overnight stay

Reviews.Title: “humid!”
Reviews.Author: bsievers4
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this hote is beautiful, the rooms have also been updated, however, the air is terrible. This hotel is so hot and humid you can't sit, sleep or nothing. I was there for a wedding and stayed 2 nights. I could not wait to go home - just to get some sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and decent price”
Reviews.Author: bmarcks
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in August for a family wedding. We got a great deal on our room through the wedding block of rooms that had been reserved. We were pleased with every aspect of our stay; the rooms are modern and well equipped, the front desk staff was very helpful and accomodating (they let us check in a couple hours early, which was really nice), and the location of the hotel made it fairly easy to get to the interesting parts of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location for our needs.”
Reviews.Author: katianna_lindley
Reviews.Content: Stayed here prior to a flight out of indy. Very good service, rooms, location. Road construction made for some pains in the neck but overall fine. We will be staying again for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed - quiet, restful, and convenient”
Reviews.Author: LizonMorton
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel after arriving at IND near midnight after a 20-hour trip, with plans to travel on the next day. I needed a dark, quiet room, good A/C, hot shower, comfortable bed, and crib for my toddler, close to the airport so we didn't have to drive far after the long trip. The Crowne Plaza met the bill. We checked in quickly despite the late arrival, and our room was dark, quiet and cool. Buffet breakfast in the hotel restaurant was fine, checkout was quick. Despite what one earlier review says (which had me worried) this hotel is in fact next to the NEW Indianapolis airport (which is actually at least 5 years old now, maybe closer to ten) but it is a good 5-minute drive on the airport access road. I wouldn't book this for my vacation, but it's perfect for what it is - an airport hotel intended for travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Very convenient for the 500.”
Reviews.Author: marypat1
Reviews.Content: I was recommened this hotel by a friend who had lived in Indy. I was not disappointed. The staff were very nice. They have a nice loung and it is convenient to the track. It is also not far from downtown - to go to the parade. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property!!”
Reviews.Author: trvlnman101
Reviews.Content: I go to Indy once a month for a meeting and always stay here. Besides clean rooms, great food in the restaurant, and a good lounge, the staff, specifically at the front desk is what really stands out. Because of the time of day I arrive, I am usually checked in by the same individual who remembers my name and really rolls out the red carpet. No negatives here.

Reviews.Title: “Good if you get on Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: dougers79
Reviews.Content: Got this property on hotwire. It was a decent place for the price paid. That said...I would never pay their full price for this property. You can tell that they have updated it but there was mold growing in my tile and to me I thought if you had so much invested in the furnishings...it may be a good idea to spray a little tilex. They advertise that their airport shuttle runs every half hour and this is false. I got to the front desk a quater till and then waited a half hour for the shuttle driver who was rather unfreindly to come out of the hotel. I would reccomend if you get a cheap deal on hotwire but thats the only way. Their service was lacking as well as the cleanliness. I WOULD stay here again if I got the same deal on hotwire (which was $52.00).

Reviews.Title: “Good location and setup for business meetings”
Reviews.Author: dhyland
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the hotel. The rooms are a little outdated. The service was good. The meeting rooms have all been updated, so very nice. Nice excercise room and pool. The lobby areas get a little hot during the day but rooms are nice and cool. The shuttle service to/from airport was also very handy (nice drivers :) ). Overall, I would stay again if on business or passing through. Not a vacation destination.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Krhone
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at this hotel. Staff were very friendly. The hotel has been recently redecorated. The pool area was very clean with ample seating and fresh towels. Kids had a great time! The rooms were clean and neat. Beds were comfortable. We had dinner at the restaurant which was really great!! Waitstaff was very friendly and food was delicious with huge portions. The restaurant is nicely decorated. The same area has Starbucks coffee in the morning and pastries for sale. Even though thus hotel is by the airport, I never heard one airplane from the pool, lobby, restaurant or our room! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice staff, everything else just ok”
Reviews.Author: DebbiesOnTheRoad
Reviews.Content: From the phone call I made the day before confirming a special request to the last person to hold a door for me on the way out, the staff was uniformly cheerful and helpful. The lobby is spacious, modern and very attractive. Unfortunately I can't say the same about the rest of the experience. The special request I was assured was no problem was not honored (quite the opposite, I got exactly what I said I didn't want.) A broken coffeemaker was not repaired or replaced. Decor is drab, and if you're working at the desk you have nowhere for a room service tray. The restaurant food and service are good, but the menu is very small and geared toward seafood. The location is convenient to the airport, but there's nothing to walk to if you're looking for somewhere else to go for dinner. At the time of this writing there's quite a bit of road construction, and if I'd had to rely on Internet directions I'd have been lost with the detours and onramp closures. There are no Gold level Priority Club perks. I won't give this a thumbs-down because it's perfectly adequate for a night if you need the loyalty program stay, but I wouldn't seek it out.

Reviews.Title: “Do not be afraid to stay here”
Reviews.Author: stewbaker151
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 26 nights in June 2011 while we waited for a house to close. The hotel is completely refurbished with plush carpets and plush linens. We utilized the free wireless, restaurant, bar, laundry, swimming pool, fitness room and whirlpool. The pool and whirlpool are indoors and the pool is heated. It does occasionally make the lobby smell like chlorine when you first walk in, but you cannot smell it in the rooms. The parking lot is ample and our cars were parked there 26 nights with no problems. There is easy access to I-70 and I-465/I-74. The wireless is really fast and easy to access (no passwords to remember). There are courtesy vans which will take you to the airport or nearby restaurants. There is Denny's, Steak and Shake, Fazoli's, etc. all not far away. Regarding the airplanes, some of the time we would hear them (and see them up close and personal) but they are going so fast, it is over quickly. The staff is friendly and helpful, especially Casey, Corey, Alex, and Mary. We stayed at another hotel across the highway and for my money, this hotel is the best value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tenholder113
Reviews.Content: Clean, updated rooms with updated appointments. Staff was incredible and very friendly. Elizabeth in the restaurant/lounge is great. She makes you feel very welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Meeting Place”
Reviews.Author: OTR22
Reviews.Content: I attended a meeting at this hotel and found it to be great. My guestroom was very comfortable, great wireless internet speed, and the bed was very comfortable. The staff was professional and friendly, and really seemed to care about the guests of the hotel. The food at all breaks and meals was exceptional. All other elements of the meeting went very well too.

Reviews.Title: “Sketchy neighborhood but very lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: agnusdei
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my extended family, several adults and teens. We enjoyed the large pool and hot tub (which was difficult to find without any signs but easy to smell because it's sunken into the lobby). They let our family stay in the pool area longer than it was open. We weren't causing any problems though, so we were grateful for the staff leaving us alone. The rooms were nicely appointed and decorated. The beds weren't as comfortable as some places that I have stayed, but they provided lots of blankets and pillow choices, which is nice. The curtains weren't darkening enough for the room, and you could hear planes every once in awhile being next door to the airport. Overall a very nice hotel at a very nice price made it perfect for catching up with extended family. On a side note, Indiana has funny liquor laws so beware of staying so far from happening downtown Indy on a Sunday and trying to purchase cash and carry alcohol for your room. It can't be done. Thankfully the Crowne Plaza has a nice bar that was open to take our money.

Reviews.Title: “Desolate Location”
Reviews.Author: Wedgewood
Reviews.Content: This property is fine so long as you accept it for what it is -- an aging hotel in a largely abandoned area. The rooms themselves are unremarkable; nothing really wrong, but nothing stands out either. The real problem is the hotel's location, across from the abandoned terminal of what used to be the Indy airport and surrounded largely by unused parking lots from that era (and an abandoned Burger King). The only things close are a few buildings still used by private planes, and a couple of other hotels that also were left behind when Indy built a new terminal on the other side of the airport property (a few miles away). Management tries to do the best with the hand it has been dealt, but the location and age of the property mean it is not the best option in that part of town.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T stay in an outer East side room!!”
Reviews.Author: webskiing
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, but do not stay in one of the outer East side rooms as you will hear planes coming and going all night long. I thought it would end after midnight, but I forgot it is a FedEx hub so it NEVER stopped! Sounded like they were going to come straight through the windows.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: acleach83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, along with our 18month old decided to travel to Indianapolis to visit the Children's Museum and Zoo. I called the generic reservations line and was told by a gentleman we would be most comfortable at the Crowne Plaza due to recent renovations and close proximity to the zoo (our other option was the holiday inn). He gave me a confirmation number and I confirmed verbally the name and location of our hotel. When we arrived at the hotel, I noticed two ladies working at the front desk. One was checking in customers and the other seemed occupied with the phone and/or paperwork (not sure what exactly). I waited my turn and then met Gloria. She asked me my name and could not find my reservation. She asked for my confirmation number (which I had mistakenly left at home over 3 hrs away). She told me there was nothing she could do without that number. I understand it was my fault that I did not have that number, but it seemed as if she wanted nothing to do with me at this point. I explained to her the conversation I had with reservations. She then stepped to another phone to make a call when a man approaches the counter dressed in business attire. The other woman at the desk drops what she is doing to assist him (when I had waited before). So apparently you need to wear business clothes to be more quickly helped there. When Gloria returned she told me my reservation was at the holiday inn at a different location. She did not offer to help us in any other way even though the mistake was made on the reservations part (holiday inn and crowne plaza are the same company and use the same system for reservations). It was her general attitude and demeaning nature that really had hurt my feelings. She wanted no part of helping me. I then asked her if she could give me directions (since she was not going to offer to do anything else) and she told me she did not know how to get there. She turned to another guy that walked up and asked him but at this point I told her I'd use my phone and figure it out. I went out to the car and told my husband who went back in and got the manager. He apologized and did give us directions to the holiday inn. By now too much time had gone by and once we traveled to the holiday inn (about 15-20mins away). We were unable to go to the zoo (we'd only have 2 hrs there). I felt this mistake was made on their reservations line and they made no effort to make up for it. Not impressed to say the least. The last thing you want is to be talked down to when you are trying to get away for a fun family trip. Definitely ruined our experience. Will not be staying at any Crowne Plaza for future travels.

Reviews.Title: “Average -- But what more do you want at an airport?”
Reviews.Author: TravellingChick
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights on a business trip because I flew in late late late and left early early early. The hotel was harder to find than one might expect. I followed signs from the airport, but they suddenly stopped. So, when I reached a crossroads, I followed the sign for High School Road and ended up in a neighborhood. As a note, it's a 10 min. drive from the airport on a road that loops counter-clockwise around the airport, past Fedex, to an airport hotel area that includes the Radisson. I operates kind of like a frontage road, running opposite the highway traffic. The lobby was expansive and beautiful, and the pool was sunken right in the middle, so you're surrounded with the Holidome-type chlorine smell as you walk to your room. The room itself was basic and mostly clean, but could have used a good dusting. The towels were an atrocious greyish-white and looked about 10 years old, but they did the job. I only heard the occasional fly-over from airplanes, and even being right next to the elevator, there was no significant hallway traffic. It took me two calls and over half an hour to get toiletries from housekeeping, but they were pleasant and quick the second time. All in all, it was a fine hotel that served its purpose!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is a gem”
Reviews.Author: kerrsnapp
Reviews.Content: i have stayed here several times in the last year or so. everything about the hotel gets my highest marks. comfortable bed, easy and free internet, good shower, helpful and polite emplyees, easy to get to, extra large rooms, very nice and comfortable lounge with great food. with most hotels i usually can find a thing or two that isn't up to par but this one is quality through and through. great value!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spear1986
Reviews.Content: I liked the rooms we had they were close to the pool, the Air/Heat in the room worked well. The shower was nice the bathroom was kinda small and there was no fan but was still very clean. The staff was very nice and I was pleased overall with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel--would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: joyfulmom
Reviews.Content: Great hotel--very up to date, room service, easy parking, very clean, courteous staff. Pool was average but appreciated. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “If the need arises, I would definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: simplelittlejoys
Reviews.Content: My oldest son had a early return flight out of Indy on Sunday, and I decided to book a room so that we wouldn't have to get up super early and drive for 2 hrs to get to the airport on time. My requirements were a pool and proximity to the airport. After checking out other reviews, I chose CP. I called CP Friday evening to inquire about the availability of a computer/printer and the young man who answered the phone was extremely polite. And on Saturday, our day of check-in, we were running behind and I knew we wouldn't be arriving at the hotel until very late. Again I called and again experienced a friendly staff to assured me that it was no problem that we would be arriving late. We finally arrived at the hotel sometime after 11 p.m. We did have to wait while the lady at check-in dealt with a couple phone calls, but once she turned her attention to us our check in was pleasant and efficient. The lady who brought up an extra blanket to our room was very nice, as well. The hotel itself is attractive, and the pool and hot tub area appeared very clean, though we were unable to use them as we had arrived so late. They have rooms with balconies that overlook the pool area/large hotel lobby, however we did not have one of these rooms. They have easily accessible computers with a printer, a lot of meeting/seating space. There is an interesting area on the 5th floor, with chairs and loveseats, and at first glance the area seems to be tastefully decorated, if not a bit outdated. But close up the chairs and loveseats are very worn and shabby. But it is a nice area to sit and also overlooks the large lobby. I am sure with time that the furnishings in this area will be updated, as the rest of the hotel was pretty nice. Our room was small, which was expected, it suited our purposes as a place to catch some sleep and be near the airport. The room decor was attractive, and the bathroom seemed nice, but the tub was small and the showerhead was low (I'm short and it still seemed low). I didn't see anything that was befitting of their "Bath Experience" or whatever was touted in their info book, and other than the very nice bathroom counter/sink area, it was pretty basic as hotel bathrooms go. UNLESS the special bathrooms are in a luxury suite or something, but I can not attest to that. They have a nicely stocked snack/necessity "shop", and they do provide items like razors and toothbrushes in case you forget to pack them. The physical of the location, while close enough to the airport - and they do offer shuttle service - leaves A LOT to be desired. The entire surrounding area was run down(I assume this has been the case since the airport moved), there was some weird "road construction" going on...and make sure you don't turn BEFORE the hotel. Drive on up past the front of the hotel to access the parking lot. The road situation was confusing and not well marked, the city/county should do something about that. Now, I want to address some of the previous reviews concerning a lack of restaurants in the hotel vicinity. I suggest you learn to use Google Maps! There are plenty of places to eat within a several mile radius, if you have a car and you don't want to eat at the hotel. Also - I did not hear one plane the fly over during our visit, which was a Saturday night. All in all, I was definitely pleased with our overnight stay and if I ever need to be close to the airport in case of an early flight I will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: GroundH2o
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in late January for a training program. It was a pleasant surprise. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful. They happily sent a fridge and microwave to me room. My room had a king bed. The bathroom was small but very functional. The best part was a lighted magnification mirror...a wonderful help to my over-40 eyes. The shower pressure was fantastic and the bed super-comfortable. My room was on the first floor and it was extremely quiet the entire visit. You could hear planes taking off at the airport nearby but they stopped by about 10 p.m. The pool and hot tub were out of commission for painting but the fitness room was very nice. We experienced an ice storm while I was there and the staff were very attentive and helpful during the storm. The bellhop/van driver stopped to help me get into my car during the storm and offered to drive me back up to the front door! I had to eat at the hotel all three nights because of the storm. The bar is small but nice with several TVs tuned to various channels. Bartenders each night were very friendly. The food in the restaurant is a bit pricey but I was glad to have an onsite restaurant so that I didn't have to leave. The burgers and fries are great, by the way. The meeting facilities are also very nice; no complaints there either. Overall, a very nice hotel that I would definitely stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near the airport. No complaints.”
Reviews.Author: maplehuggers
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the middle of the recently built complex of roads to the airport. At the time of my stay it was in the middle of what looked like a construction area and it was hard to find the way to the hotel even with the navigator. It is your classic airport hotel good for a stopover or a short stay. It meets the Crowne Plaza standard and I have no complaints. The only negative aspect was that one night we didn't want to dine at the hotel restaurant and we ventured out in the part of the city that was closer to the hotel but we didn't find it very appealing. We actually didn't feel confortable getting off the car. Other than that the hotel accomodation was rather satisfactory. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable. Soundproofing could be better but the noise of planes wasn't a major issue for us. For being an hotel close to the airport, noise could be much worse. The bathroom was ok but we had to ask for extra towels since the basic set provided daily wasn't enough for us. ( 2 adults & 2 kids). My experience with this hotel is limited to the check-in/out process, the room and the porter services for our 4 days of stay. All positive. I particularly liked the lounge in the lobby, built on different levesl with a small waterfall. Very relaxing and sophisticated.

Reviews.Title: “Swimmer Beware, Also, The night shift needs cust serv training!”
Reviews.Author: Smileydean7
Reviews.Content: We decided to book a block of rooms this New Years to ring in the new year with several other families. The hotel is in a run down area now that the airport has moved, but once you go inside the hotel, it really is quite lovely. The price was hard to beat on the holiday, and we were lucky enough to get one of the 1st floor rooms that opened up to the pool. The beds were very nice and the room was small but adequate. I was surprised to find there was no refrigerator or microwave, but there was a mini coffee pot and a table to set up some snacks for the kids. The kids from all four families (about 12 kids) swam the majority of the evening (from 7-11 pm). When the hotel staff shut the pool at 11, the kids came back to the room, but began to limp. One little boy complained that it felt as if he had a bunch of splinters in his feet. As we sat him down and propped his feet up, we saw he had little red blisters on all of his toes, and his big toes were beginning to bleed. At that moment, two brothers from another family realized they had trailed blood all the way from the pool to the room. We sat them down and saw blisters on all their toes, and their big toes were literally pouring blood. My three boys all had blisters on every toe and one of my sons had one that had begun to bleed when he got into the room. We went to the hotel front desk to ask for bandaids or access to their first aid kit, and to find out if there was any glass reported in their pool, and they rudely said they didn't provide any band aids and said that no one else was having any problems. After a little more complaining on our part, a customer service rep came to our room and saw 6 boys in our room, holding blood soaked towels against their feet. She said she only had four bandaids and that was all she could do. She then proceeded to try to take chairs away from our hotel room that we had borrowed earlier (with front desk permission) from a conference room near the front desk. She showed no concern for the kids who were injured, and too much concern over the use of chairs. The kids have emphatically said they will never go to that particular hotel again, and I wholeheartedly agree with them. I hope the Hotel owners deal with the horrid customer service the current night staff is dishing out to hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “The day the earth stood still”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay at this hotel because my company puts me up here. The front desk is either outstanding or terrible. There is no between. You will know it the minute you walk up to them. In addition, the location is odd. When you look out it is as if the earth stood still. There are empty parking lots and empty parking stuctures from where the old airport was located. You feel like the last man on earth. Also, some of the rooms do not have a window that looks outside but rather a window that looks into the atrium. This can be very noisy if there is a function going on. Please ask when you check in whether your room is an inside atrium room or an exterior room. It makes a big difference if you want to sleep

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel on just about any criterion”
Reviews.Author: kwa829
Reviews.Content: This hotel was consistent with what I understand to be the Crowne Plaza "brand promise". * Very clean and in excellent physical condition * Comfortable bedding and linens * Look and feel of room approaches "luxury" standards. * Fairly sophisticated ambience of lobby and lounge areas by the standards of suburban airport hotels. * Enjoyed the game room with a few "throwback" video games (e.g., Ms. Pac Man). * There was a pool and fitness center, neither was amazing, but they're there. On the negative side: * No folio was slid under the door, so I had to do a front desk checkout. It was about 4:45 am and there were a lot of people doing the same thing, most of whom appeared, like me, to be in a hurry to catch early flights. But the front desk clerk seemed a little frazzled and it was taking a long time to process each guest who was checking out, printer was going slow, etc. I was starting to get a little nervous as I was watching the clock. * Obviously, this is not the hotel's fault, but the immediate area is a virtual desert in terms of dining options . . no fast food, no casual dining, no fancy dining. You're basically hostage to the hotel restaurant (or the restaurant at any of the numerous other hotels nearby). If you make your way to Interstate 70 and go westbound (i.e, heading away from the city) to the first exit past the airport (about 15 minutes' drive), there are some restaurant options. Similarly, there's not much in the way of gas stations in the immediate area . . .beware in case you're in need to gas up a rental car before heading to the airport. * And, again, obviously not the hotel's fault, but just beware that despite the "airport" designation, the hotel is a ways from the airport, about 15 minutes. That's because the airport terminal apparently relocated a few years ago to the opposite end of the airport property. So, in the old days, this location was basically across the street from the terminal, but no longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ijustgottago
Reviews.Content: Checked in 11/16/2010. From the front door to the room excellent. The guy at the front desk must have sinced I had a really rough trip and gave me a nice room. Very quite, and clean. The rooms were maintained every day very well. The restaurant service is very slow and the food was not that great. Nice gym and great service. If visiting soon be aware of lots of traffic due to construction

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel near Indianapolis airport”
Reviews.Author: abhishek84
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be holiday inn and has been recently renovated and has one of the best interior that I know of. It is located very close to indianapolis airport. Staff are very friendly and they have free airport pick up too. highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: wvshopper
Reviews.Content: Enjoy my 4 night stay. Nice check-in. Clean hallways, and well lit. Nice room. Had a balcony that overlooked the atrium/pool; I enjoyed that. Room was quiet. Had new flat screen TV; not an overload of channels but enough. Each bed had 4 pillows, mattress was comfortable. Bathroom was small, but the shower had a LIGHT in it, for those of us who need to see in the shower. I loved it !! Shower had good pressure and water was hot. Only one plug-in, in the bathroom, the rest were by the desk on the other side of room. Plenty of mirrors in bathroom and outside of bathroom. I enjoyed food at the restaurant, it was good and friendly staff and about the only thing close by. I had a steak one night and it was very good, loved the french onion soup too !! This hotel is by the Fed-Ex airport terminal, but the room i had you could not hear the airplanes taking off or landing. I am not sure of the story, but I guess they built a newer airport down the road, but this hotel would have been very close to the old airport, where Fed-Ex is now. I walked by the exercise room, and it looked nice with exercise equipment, I am sure the hotel has other amenties but these are the only ones that I took advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “Only place to stay in Indy!”
Reviews.Author: sunfalcon
Reviews.Content: My dad and I have been coming to the US Nationals for a number of years. Until a couple of years ago, we were staying on the north side of town off Michigan Road. After I found out about this hotel, I was able to get a great deal on hotwire for about $60/night for three nights. It is only 15 minutes to the dragstrip and is a very nice hotel. Staff is courteous and the room is very nice. Bed is very comfortable. Bathroom is clean and modern. Free internet access. The pool and hot tub are nice as well. Very nice hotel for the money. We've been here twice now and both times, the hotel has been excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Once of the nicest rooms we've stayed in - ever.”
Reviews.Author: mewowz
Reviews.Content: First of all, we booked our room at an amazing rate for this hotel through Hotwire. It is a big, beautiful place, very convenient to Indianapolis Motor Speedway. Our room seemed recently renovated and was just beautiful. The bathroom is a wee bit teeny but I LOVED the higher counter on the vanity. The bed was firm which I find comfortable, lots of fluffy down-like pillows, nice flat screen TV. We were even next to the elevator shaft and not far from the pool, and I didn't think it was distractingly noisy. The Landings restaurant was very good and our waitress was excellent and very accommodating. The only bad thing at the restaurant was the pretzel dippers but ours were just too well done. The snickers cheesecake is wonderful. The folks at check in were very nice and respectful - one of our keys didn't work but this seems to be a curse of mine so I can't get irritated. The pool/hot tub area is not real glamorous, but it is convenient and both felt great. The pool tile could stand to be scrubbed. The towels could be about four times bigger. And the only other annoying thing was the water when I showered - I can't tell if it's too hard or too soft or what, but it was very hard to rinse soap off and feel clean. This was a surprisingly great stay overall and a great value for us. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and pretty, but inconvenient location.”
Reviews.Author: ealachan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza while in town for GenCon. Having "Airport" in the title is slightly misleading because it turns out the hotel is near the OLD airport, not the new one, which is now in use. It's a good 10 minutes' ride from the new airport, and 15 min or so from downtown. The Crowne Plaza website told us that there was a complimentary shuttle within an 8 mile radius, which is the main reason why we chose it. However, it turns out that the hotel policy is to only make runs to the airport and back, not to downtown. That made getting back and forth between the hotel and the convention center downtown expensive and time-consuming. The Green Line bus does run from the airport to the downtown area, but it's $7 each trip and then you still have to wait for the hotel shuttle to take you to the stop or pick you up. ALSO, and this is important: the website says that the airport shuttle is 24-hour, but in reality it only runs every half-hour on off hours (like very late at night or early in the morning), so unless you plan accordingly, you run a very real risk of missing a flight if you happen to be trying to get to the airport at, say, 5am!!!! Our room was very nice, very clean, and exceedingly comfortable. The shower was GREAT, the mini coffee-maker in the room was most appreciated, and the lobby was very pretty. However, the front-desk staff was less than helpful on most occassions, the room service was severely overpriced for the quality of food that we got, and if you're in one of the rooms toward the lobby-end of the halls, the noise from the pool can be excessive. All in all, our stay wasn't terrible, but as the week wore on we started to get frustrated with the inconvenience of the location, especially with having to tote around lots of heavy stuff for the Con.

Reviews.Title: “good in a pinch”
Reviews.Author: AnotherDawn
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights here. It's an older hotel, but still has the full service and amenities you expect from a Crowne Plaza. It's easy to get to from the highway and there was plenty of parking. We got a good rate via Hotwire, which they honored without comment. We got a smaller room I think, but it was clean and spacious enough for sleeping which was all we really needed. Housekeeping could have been better, some counter surfaces did not get wiped down, and they do not change sheets unless you request it. Only heard planes one night when due to stormy weather they used an alternate runway. Otherwise it was very quiet. There is *nothing* near the hotel other than more hotels, no food or shopping nearby so you have to drive if you want dinner out or need a drug store. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Won't return. Disappoionting stay.”
Reviews.Author: uww326
Reviews.Content: We're searching for a hotel we can stay at every year for the Indy 500 and this won't be it. Tiny bathrooms. Fuzzy tv stations and only 33 channels and only one movie channel. Shuttle won't go downtown. Room service breakfast was overpriced and terrible quality. Worst room service breakfast I've ever had. Stopped both mornings for coffee at the coffee shop, and both times it was hard to get someone to help us. When they did, the service was bad. Met one very friendly man at the front desk but one rude unhelpful woman. The pool is small and has a sterile environment - no plants or decorations. No fridge in the room. Internet was free but slow. Room was clean and cleaning staff was good. Noisy air conditioner in the room kept us awake. Overall, I know we can do much much better than this.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ptt76
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Crowne Plaza the last few times that I have been in Indianapolis, and I love it. The hotel has been newly renovated, and looks beautiful. The staff is always very friendly and helpful. The beds in the rooms are very comfortable. Even though the hotel is near a fed-ex flight path, the noise of the planes did not bother me at all. The next time that I am in Indianapolis I will difinitely stay at the Crowne Plaza again.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Loud”
Reviews.Author: aztraverler04
Reviews.Content: Be careful when staying here if you are looking for a good night of sleep. I was unaware that the planes would be flying a couple hundred feet directly over this hotel. We defintately suffered the consequences. We weren't able to get to bed until around 1:00 am when the planes finally stoped coming into the airport. Overall the hotel was nice on the inside but just be catious about the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel another wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: mpaulet
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel prior to my morning flight. It is an excellent value. I have stayed at this hotel several times and am always pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel - Beautiful, Clean, Family Friendly and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: kgill1125
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza over our mini spring break getaway. We were looking for a hotel that was nice and central to some of our planned destinations. The Crowne Plaza was recommended to us by some friends who spoke very highly of the recent renovations and the hotel staff. Our experience was great. The hotel was very clean, the staff was very friendly and most accomodating and the decor was absolutely beautiful. The family friendly atmosphere allowed our children to enjoy the swimming pool/hot tub and arcade area. There was ample parking all around the hotel so parking was never an issue. My family and I will definitely be staying at the Crowne Plaza for our future trips to Indianapolis. Thank You to the staff and management for making our experience a most enjoyable one!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Harley1961
Reviews.Content: I spend 60+ business nights a year in hotels and have for several years now. And I have tried lots of hotels in different cities looking for both value and customer service. For the last year when I am in Indy I stay at the Crowne Plaza Airport. The value is Great. Rooms are always nice. The staff are all friendly even before they got to know me. And now several of them are like good friends and I look forward to staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone should stay here - great location and great staff = great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ndfan0714
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding hotel that is close to both downtown and the airport. The service is fantastic from the frontdesk to the restaurant/lounge, etc. The rooms are all remodeled with comfortable beds and flat screen TVs. I would recommed everyone to stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great STAY”
Reviews.Author: tomd19
Reviews.Content: I came to the CP at the Airport and what a suprise. The shuttle picked me up and saw I was late and called to have the restaurant stay open. The staff checked me in and brought my bags to my room, I went to the restaurant and the chef prepared me a huge cob salad and gave me the best lowfat asian dressing! when i got to my room everything was brand new- the room looked great and the bed was so cumpfy! This was the best night sleep i had on the road in a while. In the am i had STARBUCKS and off to my meeting. Thanks CP Indy Airport! Thomas

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for where it is located”
Reviews.Author: silentsnowkat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here because I was attending a work seminar at the hotel. The hotel and rooms where clean and nice. The heater was very noisy though and the shower head was about a foot too low so it was hard for me to wash my hair. The hotel is on the airport property and fed ex planes fly over it at all hours of the day and night. They are noisy but I got used to it and expected to hear them since the hotel is so close to the airport. Since it is on airport property there are no resturants, shopping or entertainment near the hotel. You have to drive several miles away from the hotel to find a nice place to eat or find anything to do. I would never stay here if I was on a vacation but if it were just for work or a lay over for a flight I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Unsafe - no security”
Reviews.Author: golfer147
Reviews.Content: I was one of 30 cars broken into. No security at this location. I drove 70 miles without a passenger window. Natually their insurance carrier denied the claim already and treated me like crap. The manager was a 20 something unprofessional wimp. DO NOT STAY HERE. THIS IS A BAD LOCATION and HAS NO SECURITY. THEY WERE EVEN RUDE ON CHECK IN before I had a problem. PLEASE STAY HERE AT YOUR OWN RISK!!!! I CANNOT EXPRESS WHAT A NIGHTMARE THIS WAS for me. It was during my companies national sales meeting and totally ruined the event for me. THUMBS DOWN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for the money spent on Priceline!”
Reviews.Author: IndianaRealtor
Reviews.Content: We were flying out of Indy Feb. 10 for South Beach and due to the snowstorms in northern Indiana drove down the night before. Very nice hotel, but we really didn't check it out since we arrived so late. Room was very nice. Tile bathroom. We didn't ask if there was a king bed available so when we got to our room we had two full beds. Beds and pillows were very comfy but beds were small. My hubby and I each grabbed a bed and crashed. My only complaints are the drop down ceiling in bathroom (made cheap an otherwise beautiful room #217) and the heat vent in the wall (it rattled EVERY time the heat came on). The bathroom ceiling is me being picky and the vent could easily be fixed. I would definitely stay here again. Had room service for breakfast and that was good as well. Staff amazing. Especially for Priceline at $50.00!!

Reviews.Title: “Our SUV was vandalized and this hotel is doing nothing to help us!!!!”
Reviews.Author: akm71
Reviews.Content: We stayed Jan. 30th and left for our vacation early Saturday morning which all we thought was going great. The following Saturday we returned around 6:00p.m. to find our passenger side window was completely destroyed and shattered glass was all over the inside along with missing items. The airport shuttle employee acted like no big deal and made us carry our luggage to the check-in desk to talk to the manager on duty. After waiting for approx. 5-10 minutes for her to arrive she said there was nothing she could do about this matter!!!! I asked her when our car had been vandalized and she told me our car was one of three cars that this happened to. We asked her to call the police and while we waited for them to arrive she left us, not offering to do anything! After the kind policeman told us this happens alot in this area, we tried to find the manager again to ask her for a shop-vac so we could vacuum out piles of shattered glass on our front seats and floor. She said she would check for one and after 20 minutes went by, she could not help us with this either? When I asked for another manager to talk to she told me they would not be available until Sunday or Monday which she did provide their names to me. I then asked her if she could provide a complimentary room to us for our trouble and figure out how we were going to drive home 3 hours north without a window in 20* weather - of course she could not help us again and wanted us to pay a discounted rate - OMG!!!!! So then I asked her for some cardboard & heavy masking tape to make a passenger window to attempt to drive home ( waited another 15 minutes for these). While my husband almost froze to death constructing this window out of nothing, I asked her for at least a broom & dust pan to sweep all of the glass out of my car. She provided these too after 10 minutes of waiting and by this time I have FIRE coming out of my ears in extreme anger!!! Wouldn't you by now??? I then asked her to personally follow me out to my car so she could actually feel what my husband & I were going through but that was a waste of my time!!!! She said she knew what our car & the other two looked liked after days of them sitting in their parking lot and NOT getting a phone call to report this to us. We had our cell-phones on vacation and if we would have gotten a phone call when this happened we could have contacted people to help us during the week and not on Super Bowl weekend when everyone was closed. So I hope you are reading this Mark (General Manager of Crowne Plaza) and are willing to help us because so far none of your staff has!?

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for the money, rooms are updated.”
Reviews.Author: jnp3211
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, although its location is out there. It's across from the old airport, putting it in the middle of nowhere. The fitness center is great with a few, select equipment that is new with flat screen TVs. The rooms are updates with nice bathrooms and flat screen TV (although, no HD). The rooms are spacious and the lobby is clean and elegant. The staff isn't overly friendly but not bad. Sign up for the Crowne Plaza member program and get free drinks in the bar!

Reviews.Title: “My Trip to Indy”
Reviews.Author: member70
Reviews.Content: The stay was awsome! We were upgraded to a suite and had sushimi and bud light!

Reviews.Title: “Above average Crowne Plaza leaves nothing to be desired”
Reviews.Author: bryan240
Reviews.Content: I've been all over the world and stayed in some of the finest hotels. I had a full 24 hours before my flight left and didn't have a car to drive around, so this was my home for a day. I booked my room on Hotwire and I got a great deal. When I saw "Crowne Plaza" as the hotel after booking, I hesitated. My experience with this brand has been mixed, but mostly average. The second I walked in, I knew this place was different. The bellman, who was exceptionally well dressed, opened the door for me and welcomed me. He took my bags and walked me to the counter for check-in. The front desk staff are mature and competent. They wasted no time at all and were cheerful and friendly, despite the frigid weather than came through the night before. I checked in early, at 2 pm and was not given any hassle for the time being early, as happens in some hotels (I generally check in early and leave early, when possible). I was given a free drink coupon for the bar because I'm a Priority Club member. I went to my room. Along the walk and elevator ride, an overwhelming sense of "quality" was felt, like no other Holiday Inn product I'd ever experienced. Everything was so tasteful and well-appointed. There wasn't a piece of wallpaper peeled back, not a speck of paint out of place, nothing to complain about appearance. My room was modern and freshly renovated. Flat screen television was wonderful and worked flawlessly. The hotel bar and restaurant are decent, but a little on the pricey side. I ate breakfast in the restaurant, but ordered delivery for dinner from a local restaurant for a better value. Check out was convenient and quick. The shuttles run constantly during peak hours. This hotel is no longer facing the terminal since Indianapolis International Airport opened their new terminal building. Across the street is the old terminal, still sitting there, but no more activity. The shuttle takes about 10 minutes to get to the new terminal and was clean and well-appointed, just like the hotel. I read the reviews from people complaining about airplane noise. Well, let's be honest, this is a hotel that is literally at the airport. What would one expect? No noise? You've got to view this issue with a degree of reason. One of the runways has an approach literally over the hotel and it's not the most used runway here. It's used more during the day than night. I slept soundly all night. There is, as was pointed out, a major FedEx hub at this airport (second only to Memphis) and it operates after midnight. This is not your grandfather's 707. These planes are all very modern and not nearly as loud and planes of the past. I didn't really notice anything and I was on the top floor. No vibrations or anything like that. Just a highly muted "whoosh" here and there. The A/C in the room is louder. The building is well-insulated from the sound in my opinion. All in all, this hotel was a great value. It would be a great value at triple what I paid for the room through Hotwire. I got lucky, I guess. This hotel could just as well be a Marriott. The service is great, abundant, and the hotel just screams "class." I think I'm enthusiastic about it because it really was such a pleasant surprise. I don't expect to be "wowed" by Holiday Inn very often, but this Crowne Plaza is where it's at.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: jamandkam
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. The airport noise is minimal since the terminal moved, yet it's still less than 10 minutes to the airport. The rooms are large, clean and well appointed. Warning for tall travelers, the shower head is lower than usual.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and comfortable indoor hotel located near airport”
Reviews.Author: Cheapseater
Reviews.Content: Really nice rooms! Very comfortable hotel with friendly staff. Good location for traveling about Indy. Will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Your Earplugs”
Reviews.Author: babelmendab
Reviews.Content: If you are considering this property be forwarned that the walls are paper thin and that you can literally hear with great clarity and detail the conversations of those in adjacent rooms. I almost thought there might be a hole in the wall, that's how clearly the the sounds transmitted from the next room. Thank god the neighbors didn't engage in more intimate acts. Don't be deceived by the pictures on the site, also, the property is directly under the flight path of landing and taking off jets from Indy airport. Check in staff very unhelpful and unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: stumperman1
Reviews.Content: We had to wake up early and get to the airport, and decided to stay here on a few friends recommendations. We were glad we did. The rooms were wonderful and very roomy. The beds were comfortable and the hotel was fairly quiet which made getting to bed early a little easier. The staff was helpful, and the transportation to the airport left on time and got us right to our terminal.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed it...”
Reviews.Author: DeadOn
Reviews.Content: We were leaving the airport early and decided to stay close to avoid the early morning drive. The hotel has been renovated recently and it's shows. We had two queens beds with new. The bathroom was very nice and clean. We stayed on the executive level and had access to the lounge (TV, Computer/Printer, Stocked Fridge, etc.). Oh yeah, the kids hit the indoor pool! Shuttle service was ready first thing and we arrived on time. The hotel offers extended parking and like someone else stated, do the ride-n-fly pricing and this is the way to go. We got an additional hour of sleep in the morning! We will definitely stay here each time we fly!

Reviews.Title: “Sound location, with a lot of sounds ...”
Reviews.Author: KTB75
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel through a deal on Hotwire. If I had paid full price for this room, I may have felt more strongly about the little things wrong with it. Unlike many reviewers I didn't hear the FedEx planes all night. Instead, I heard the forced air vents rattle all night. Otherwise the room was clean and neat. The complementary soaps were a bit sub-par for the hotel class., however The shuttle to the airport leaves every 30 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Noise of FedEx Planes Landing and Taking Off All Night”
Reviews.Author: John073
Reviews.Content: Since ours was a quick stay only for catching an early morning flight, this review does not comment upon anything other than our experience trying to sleep. Sometime around 12 midnight, I was awoken by the loud sound of an airplane apparently landing. Several minutes went by and just as I was falling back asleep, another very loud noise blast from an airplane was heard. Several minutes later, another, and so on. I did not sleep past 12 midnight as the numerous panes passing by made sleep impossible. I do not know if we had the misfortune to have a room facing the airport runway but there is a huge FedEx facility next to the hotel and presumably the noise we heard from planes were the multiple FedEx hub flights that must land each weekday night at the FedEx facility. I would not ever stay at this hotel again even though it is convenient to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully renovated hotel”
Reviews.Author: athenian01
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised by this hotel. It is a former Holiday Inn Select that they transformed into a Crowne Plaza. They did a very nice job with the renovations, beautiful common areas, nicely renovated contemporary rooms. The hotel was classified as a 3.5 star, and deserves this rating. We booked the hotel on a discount site for $50, so it was an excellent value. One negative, it is located next to the old airport terminal that is no longer in use for commercial airlines, so the area is very dead. However, the hotel has complimentary transportation to the new terminal. I would deffinetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: ATLnacho
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife and parents for my brother's graduation in Bloomington. It is located just outside the airport, and well situated for a drive to Bloomington (not sure about other IND attractions, since we were not there for long). It was great value for money, we paid about $65 incl tax per room (2 double beds) through hotwire, apparently you can get rooms for less as well. Check in process was smooth and rooms were great. Clean, decent size and well decorated. Only complaint was with room service breakfast, which was served about 10 minutes past the time indicated, which caused a bit of a problem since we had to drive to Bloomington in the morning, and the room service delivery person hung around my parents room expecting a tip (which they gave her), even though a 20% gratuity was included in the bill. There's a small coffee shop/bar and a restaurant on the premises. Be aware that the roads around the airport and the exact location of the airport have changed, and most GPS units do not have the new roads as they are, but you should not have major trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect Good Service”
Reviews.Author: kkboy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location during the race several times and it has been ok but my last experience with them insures I will never return. We were staying this time using my Holiday Inn Priority Points. The reception people treated us like we were homeless white trash, making a number of negative comments to us including the fact that they decided we did not qualify for their breakfast cupons, a first, we had the free breakfast every other time we stayed their. We were not offered help with our lugage, I am 70 years old and could have used a little help. When we got to the room we found that they had put us in a King bed room, we had reservations for a room with two beds because there were 4 people in our party. When I returned to the desk, they basically refused to talk to us and would not even look at my reservation paper work which clearly showed 4 people and 2 beds reservation. They told us tough, they could not or would not help us and that we would have to deal with it. I thought Platinum Priority Club Members were important to Holiday Inn but obviously not to this Hotel. There are numerious other nice hotels and hotel staffs in Indianapolis, I certainly would never suggest putting yourself through this agrivation. These people have no concept of what customer service is.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel. One of the best in Indy.”
Reviews.Author: myoffering
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in almost every hotel in downtown Indy over the past couple of years. My wife and I take weekend get away trips. This time we decided to try something different so we did not have to pay the high parking fees. The Crown Plaza turned out to be GREAT!! We got the room for $48 a night from Hotwire so you cannot beat the price. The room was very clean, well maintained and up-to-date. The bed was amazing. There were 9 pillows on the bed of which 6 were for sleeping. Very comfortable and relaxing. The flat panel TV provided plenty of entertainment after a long day of walking around the White River State Park area. The staff was very helpful and professional. Oh and the water pressure was ridiculous to the point it was almost too strong. You almost don't even have to use soap to get clean. The other nice thing about the bath room was they must have a hot water recirculation system because there is no waiting at all for hot water. We did not try the restaurant or the pool but the pool looked very clean. The hotel is very large and has a beautiful lobby. It is in the flight path of the airport but the noise was hardly noticeable when the plains flew over. It is located just off of 465 so it is very easy to get to and from the hotel. The parking lot is well light and we felt very safe and comfortable through out the hotel property. If you stay at the Crown Plaza and are looking for a way downtown you can go straight north of the hotel on High School road and turn east on Washington. If you're looking for a great place to eat I suggest Cheeseburger in Paradise in the Southport area just off of 65 south of 465. Live music every night and the wait staff was great. I will be staying at the Crown Plaza again. Hopefully with a great deal like I got this time but I would not be angry if I would have paid $130 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding Crowne Plaza Experience”
Reviews.Author: jimbol227
Reviews.Content: Not only is this hotel aesthetically pleasing, but the staff is professional and detail oriented. I would recommend the Airport Crowne Plaza to the discriminating traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kayvee
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Great service, great amenities, great stay. Somebody is really paying attention to the details. It's architecture may be a little dated, but the recent renovations are well-done and it is beautifully decorated, which makes it feel more retro (?) than outdated I think. The pictures on their website do not do it justice--I hope they update them soon. The lobby is in a 5-story atrium. The hotel is obviously business-oriented with lots of informal gathering/sitting places in the lobby for all sizes of groups in addition to many conference and theater-type rooms. There were a few computers in the lobby and a business center as well. We were there Jan. 1 and 2 so there were no business people there, just a few families. We were able to get a great price via Priceline and I assume it was because it was a slow time for them. Our rooms were very nicely decorated, beds were great with lots of pillows and new, crisp white sheets and bedding. Everything was spotless. Nice, thick bath towels. Bathroom is a little small--hard to fit two adults in front of the mirror. We had to wait a long time for the hot water to kick in in our room, but in our sons' room it came on right away. Great shower head with an adjuster for spray and massage--good water pressure. Nice size flat screen t.v. and port for laptop in room at the desk. Lots of attention paid to details, for example, hair dryer was not the usual wall-mounted variety, but a full-size dryer (stored in a cloth bag), lighted make-up mirror, nicer toiletries with flip-tops, morning paper placed in cloth bag and hung over the door knob. Numerous nice little details--gave a very professional impression. I had read an earlier review that complained about some airport noise, so we requested a room where that would not be a factor when we checked in and we didn't hear a single plane. Our 2nd floor room had patio door access to a balcony walkway that overlooked the pool and atrium. Some of the kids were a little noisy, but it was completely quiet starting at 10 p.m. One of our sons took the airport shuttle at 4:30 a.m. The driver was there and waiting, very personable and friendly. Even the front desk staff came over and visited. All of the staff that we encountered were courteous and helpful. My husband and I had breakfast in the hotel dining room and it was very good--a little on the expensive side, but not beyond what you would expect to pay for a hotel restaurant. Near the entrance to the restaurant there was a take-out counter with a variety of foods to pick up on the go. I didn't really pay attention to all that they had, but did see cinnamon rolls, muffins and fresh fruit cups as we walked past. There was a small but very nice exercise room with treadmills, elipticals, bikes, weights, and a small refigerator with complimentary bottled water. Several t.v.s. It all seemed to be new or mostly new equipment and everything that we used was in good shape. Even though this hotel is business-oriented, I would recommend it for holidays/weekends for families or non-business groups as well--as long as they don't mind driving to restaurants, etc. The hotel is right at the airport and you do have to drive to get to anything, but it is very convenient to I-465.

Reviews.Title: “Nice newly renovated hotel”
Reviews.Author: bnich618
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, the lobby is beautiful - apparantly they are just finishing up a total renovation. The room was nicely decorated, very comfortable bed, lovely linens and a very nice bathroom. There is a noise issue since the airport landing pattern is right overhead - you could almost touch them! I was awakened at 3:35am by a landing plane but promptly went back to sleep. They have a nice restaurant but we didn't eat there. It's very easy to find right off of the Indianapolis bypass 465 at the airport. The price was right and I'd go there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Crowne Plaza Indianapolis Airport
HotelInfo.Address: 2501 South High School Road, Indianapolis, IN 46241 (Formerly Holiday Inn Select Indianapolis Airport)
